column5: looking for contact info for the guide on this lac I also think its called Theodat, I believe he is a cree indian. any info would be helpful
I hope you will post your results or pm me. Thanks
hopefully it will get posted here
vteye pm me and I will give you info Thanks
The Lac is also called Theodat

if you plan to go there,i have 2 boats up there.the road is pretty bad.towing a boat trailor can get you in trouble if you have a breakdown.also there are many side roads which can get you lost.you may have to take extra gas with you.(for the vehicle).most vehicles cant make it in and out on one tank. you burn a lot of gas on that road..if able is there he may sell you gas but it will cost you.its very remote.after early spring you can expect very few people using that road.also watch for rocks .take an extra outboard.
It sounds like a lake that a fly in outfitter should put a couple of cabins on. I have no idea what's involved in accomplishing that but if it's a great fishing lake, people would pay to get in.

Thanks Brochet That offer sounds good, I think along with Eric, not only will we be fishing Hebert again, we are planning on going to Doda before we go to Hebert, with our new boat. maybe we could meet you guys up there. Mishagomish will have to wait for a trip by its self that sucker it up there I did talk to the Cree Chief (abelskitchen) and have his contact # His prices were not bad for the quality of fishing Fishron the trip to Doda may just do that, no outfitter on the lac. Name for outfitter Is Walleye Ron's
